Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should have one face, face\\_1. Face\\_1 should have four lines, arranged in a rectangular shape, and one circle in the center. Specifically: * Line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.2931] * Line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.2931], End Point [0.0, 0.2931] * Line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.2931], End Point [0.0, 0.0] * Circle\\_1: Center [0.3992, 0.1466], Radius 0.0069 The loop consisting of Line\\_1, Line\\_2, Line\\_3, and Line\\_4 forms a rectangle, while Circle\\_1 is a circular hole in the rectangle. Next, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75, and then transform it into a 3D sketch using the given Euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch by 0.0256 units towards the normal direction and add it to the previous model to create a new solid body. The resulting shape has dimensions of 0.75 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.0256 units in height, with a sloped side at a 45-degree angle. **Part 2: Construct two parallel cylindrical rods, one slightly taller than the other.** Create a new coordinate system at the position [0.0881, 0.0881, 0.0256] with no rotation. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch should have four faces, face\\_1 through face\\_4. Each face should have a single circle in the center, with the following coordinates: * Face\\_1: Circle\\_1: Center [0.0129, 0.0129], Radius 0.0129 * Face\\_2: Circle\\_1: Center [0.0129, 0.104], Radius 0.0129 * Face\\_3: Circle\\_1: Center [0.5609, 0.0129], Radius 0.0129 * Face\\_4: Circle\\_1: Center [0.5609, 0.104], Radius 0.0129 Next, extrude each circle by 0.2016 units in the opposite direction of the normal. Since there are four circles, this will result in two cylindrical rods, one slightly taller than the other. The two rods have the same width and length of 0.5738 units, while the height of the taller rod is 0.2016 units and the shorter rod is 0.0 units shorter.</description>
